Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 59th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1982...
Injured on 7/18/1982 with a Strained Rib Cage Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 5/7/1986, off Aldo Cahoon (PG)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/9/1986, off Freeman Vosburg (SHP)...
Injured on 5/22/1986 with a Tight Knee, out for one week...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Troy on 4/16/1987...
Traded from New Jersey to Plum Grove on 7/20/1988 (Going to NJ: CF G. Jacobs. Going to PG: RF D. Cifuentes, 1B J. Llorent)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1989, hitting .474 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1989...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 2/13/1992 to a 3-year deal worth $966,000 per year...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1992...
